edu.csupomona.cs.cs141.prog_assgmnt_4

Class Animal

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.csupomona.cs.cs141.prog_assgmnt_4.Animal
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Serializable
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    Bird, Dog, Fish

    public abstract class Animal
extends Object
implements Serializable
    The Animal object represents a general way to keep track of the animals that come to our veterinary office. It will have subclasses that represent a Dog, a Fish, and a Bird.
    Author:
    David Scianni
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      private int age
      We keep the age of the animal, so that we can reference any disorders or diseases that can affect the animal during certain years of its life.
      private String animalType
      This String will keep track of the subclass that is made.
      private Appointment[] apps
      This array will hold all the appointments that the animal has at our hospital.
      private Disease[] illness
      This array will keep track of any diseases that the animal has, or had during its lifetime..
      private Owner master
      This is the owner of the Animal.
      private String name
      This is the name of the animal.
      private static long serialVersionUID
      This is the default serial ID for the Animal object.

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Animal(Owner m, String n, int a)
      This constructor will set the master to m, the name to n and the age to a.

    • Field Detail

      • serialVersionUID

        private static final long serialVersionUID
        This is the default serial ID for the Animal object.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • master

        private Owner master
        This is the owner of the Animal. Since every animal in our system has an owner, It is kept in the superclass, rather than writing one for each of the subclasses.

      • name

        private String name
        This is the name of the animal. We keep the name so that we can keep track of the animal, and can use it's name to search for specific animals.

      • age

        private int age
        We keep the age of the animal, so that we can reference any disorders or diseases that can affect the animal during certain years of its life.

      • illness

        private Disease[] illness
        This array will keep track of any diseases that the animal has, or had during its lifetime..

      • apps

        private Appointment[] apps
        This array will hold all the appointments that the animal has at our hospital.

      • animalType

        private String animalType
        This String will keep track of the subclass that is made. If a Dog is made, then the animalType will be Dog, if it's a Bird, then the animalType will be Bird and if a Fish, the animalType will be Fish.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Animal

        public Animal(Owner m,
      String n,
      int a)
        This constructor will set the master to m, the name to n and the age to a. Then it will instantiate and initialize the illness and apps arrays to size 50 and fill them with null pointers.
        Parameters:
        m - The owner of the animal
        n - The name of the animal
        a - the age of the animal

    • Method Detail

      • appSize

        public int appSize()
        First, this method will make a temporary variable temp and make it equal to 0. Then it will check the apps array, and if the ith variable is not null, it will add 1 to temp. When a null pointer is found, then it will break the for loop, and return the temp number. This temp will be how many variables are in the array that are not null.
        Returns:
        temp, which is the number of non-null variables in the array

      • illnessSize

        public int illnessSize()
        First, this method will make a temporary variable temp and make it equal to 0. Then it will check the illness array, and if the ith variable is not null, it will add 1 to temp. When a null pointer is found, then it will break the for loop, and return the temp number. This temp will be how many variables are in the array that are not null.
        Returns:
        temp, which is the number of non-null variables in the array

      • addAppointment

        public void addAppointment(Appointment a)
        This will add an appointment to the apps array in the next available spot in the array, which would be at appSize()
        Parameters:
        a - Is the Appointment being added to the apps array

      • addDisease

        public void addDisease(Disease d)
        This will add a Disease to the illness array in the next available spot in the array, which would be at illnessSize()
        Parameters:
        d - Is the Disease being added to the illness array

      • subtractAppointment

        public void subtractAppointment(Appointment a)
        This will take in an appointment and check all of the apps array for that appointment. If it is found, then it will make that app equal to the app in the next cell, and will continuously move them down one by one until all the apps are moved one cell to the left. It will then make the last cell into null, so to complete the subtraction of the appointment a.
        Parameters:
        a - The appointment you wish to subtract

      • setDiseaseStatus

        public void setDiseaseStatus(int n,
                    boolean s)
        Sets the status of a disease in the illness array to either current or past.
        Parameters:
        n - The number of the disease in the illness array
        s - The status of the disease. true for current or false for past.

      • getOwner

        public Owner getOwner()
        This gets the owner of the animal
        Returns:
        master, or the owner of the animal

      • getName

        public String getName()
        Gets the name of the animal
        Returns:
        name, which is the animals name.

      • getAge

        public int getAge()
        gets the age of the animal
        Returns:
        age, or the animals age.

      • printAnimal

        public abstract void printAnimal()
        Abstract method that will print out the animals information. It is different for the Dog object because Dog has vaccinations as well. Besides that, they all print out the Owner's info, their info, and any diseases and appointments they have.

      • printIllness

        public void printIllness()
        This will print out any diseases that the animal has. If it doesn't have any it will print none, but if it does it will print the name of the disease and the status of it.

      • printAppointment

        public void printAppointment()
        This will print out the information of any and all appointments the animal has. If they have none, then none will be displayed

      • getAnimalType

        public String getAnimalType()
        This will get the animal type, which is either Dog, Bird, or Fish
        Returns:
        the animal's type

      • setAnimalType

        public void setAnimalType(String animalType)
        This sets the type of the animal to either Dog, Bird, or Fish
        Parameters:
        animalType - is the string that will be the animal type. Will be either Dog, Bird, or Fish
